attributes.action: Cut the excessive announcements on train journeys.
attributes.additional_details: The frequency and repetitive nature of on-board train announcements has now reached an intolerable level. Being told the same thing multiple times per journey is un-necessary and unwelcome noise pollution. It particularly affects older people who have less capacity to filter out unwanted noise. People should be left in peace during journeys.  At the very least, a quiet coach should be provided on every service where passengers can escape from the unwanted noise.
attributes.background: Ensure that Train Operating Companies reduce the number of on-train announcements to the same level as they were in Year 2000 or earlier.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about how many announcements to give on individual train journeys are a matter for train companies, not the UK Government or Parliament.
